page.title: 03FATIMA CHURCH ,HARLOW .
page.content: { {Father Francis Burgess},a Roman Catholic priest for 55 years ,moved from Epping to{Harlow}in 1952 .When he first came to his parish there was only one house called Moot House ,now a community centre in the middle of the{Stow},a busy shopping centre . Only twelve people attended his first service but because he knew Harlow was going to become a big new town , he started building a church ,called { {Our Lady of Fatima}.Built in 1960, it took 18 months to complete.The cross on top of the 80 foot steeple was kissed by the children of{St.Alban's {school}before it was erected by crane. Fatima Church ,designed by{Gerald {Goalem},has spectacular stained glass windows which were made by monks of{ {Buckfast Abbey}.Inside is a terracotta statue of Christ the King .
